title: People shouldn't be allow to play champions they never played in ranked
body:
At this point, after the mastery system had been out for so long, when someone plays a chanp they have no mastery level on, it basiclly tells you the player either:
1.doesn't play the champion enough to actually know the champion.
2. is a newbie.

both of which really hurts the chance of the team winning.

Maybe mastery lv3 is a decent limit? that is like what? 10 wins?

replies.body:
It hasn't been out for "so long" at all. I'm still missing mastery 3+ on champions that I _know_ how to play, but haven't played recently or often enough. I have over 4000 games played; I'm not a newbie. If the system came out earlier, I would have mastery 5 on a TON of champions.

I totally get where you're coming from, but your solution only works for new(er) players to the game. Veteran players are still missing masteries. It will take time to catch up 100%, if it ever happens... I personally don't want to grind mastery levels just to be "allowed" to use my champion pool...
Even mastery 2 just to filter out ppl who 1st time things in ranked would help.

> People shouldn't be allow to play champions they never played in ranked

So... I can't play a champion in ranked, until I play them in ranked.

https://media.giphy.com/media/glmRyiSI3v5E4/giphy.gif
Use your reading skills boy. Stop falling asleep in class and you'd be able to understand what he said, it means play a champ in norms first.

I know what he wanted to say.
However that doesn't mean, the sentence itself contains the intended information.

Anyway, have I said something like, _"You can't spell for shit"_ for you to get so aggressive towards me?

Bah, whatever. I shouldn't expect a lot from a person who can't even punctuate correctly half of the time.
with 10 wins i can get mastery 5. Maybe its based on what rating you get as well

100% Agreed. However, what about smurfs that have actually played that champion several times. Now they "Can't" play it? 

I see both sides to it. But if you are first picking or counter picking OP that you can't play you don't understand league anyways. 

SO preventing those players form picking the champ they haven't played won't do much really...

Or... they can. Makes you wonder who some people are when they say how things should go.

Elo is influence and a voice, unless you're like masters... this is just someone being salty because it happened in your game.
Wtf? let them play whatever they want, dont judge anyone like that, even if you have mastery 7 on a champ you can still feed it is possible, while the one without a mastery can be a god
